justification: “This is, among other things, evident in mousetracking studies, which make it possible to quantify people's conflicts by tracking their mouse trajectories as they make decisions.”
“Nohlen et al. (2016) demonstrated in a facial electromyography study that people experience negative affect in response to ambivalence…”
“…following dissonance inductions, people not only report experiencing more discomfort (Elliot & Devine, 1994)….”
“…they also show heightened neural and facial activity related to negative affect (Martinie et al., 2013; van Veen et al., 2009).”
